description: The dashboard provides insights of request performance of Azure Apps through Application Insights.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
let minDuration = iif(isempty("$min_duration"), "0", "$min_duration");
let maxDuration = iif(isempty("$max_duration"), "0", "$max_duration");

requests// additional filters can be applied here
| where $__timeFilter(timestamp)
| where client_Type != "Browser"
| where ("All" in ($operation_name) or operation_Name in ($operation_name))
| where duration >= todouble(minDuration) and duration <= todouble(maxDuration)
// calculate average request duration for all requests
| summarize AVG = avg(duration), P95 = percentiles(duration, 95), MAX = max(duration) by bin(timestamp, $__interval)
| project timestamp, AVG = AVG/1000, P95 = P95/1000, MAX = MAX/1000
| order by timestamp asc

panels.title: Count of Requests by Server Response Time (sec)

options.content: Click on a bar on the chart below to set the minimum and maximum duration. To reset the zoom, change the Minimum Duration and Maximum duration variables.

panels.description: Click on a bar on the chart below to set the minimum and maximum duration. To reset the zoom, change the Minimum Duration and Maximum duration variables.
panels.title: Request Count by Duration (ms)

azureLogAnalytics.query:
requests
// additional filters can be applied here
| where $__timeFilter(timestamp)
| where client_Type != "Browser"
| count

panels.description: Click on an operation name to filter this dashboard.

value.title: Show list of transactions matching operation name

azureLogAnalytics.query:
let dataset = requests
| where $__timeFilter(timestamp)
| where client_Type != "Browser"
;
dataset
| summarize  Avg = avg(duration)/1000, Max = max(duration)/1000, Count = count()
| project operation_Name="All", Avg, Max, Count
| union(dataset
| summarize  Avg = avg(duration)/1000, Max = max(duration)/1000, Count = count() by operation_Name
| top 20 by Avg desc
)

panels.title: Top 20 Operation Names by count

panels.description: Click on the OperationID or Name to open the trace details in explore mode.
panels.title: Top 20 Sample Operations matching $operation_name by Relevance

azureLogAnalytics.query:
requests
| where $__timeFilter(timestamp)
| where client_Type != "Browser"
| summarize count() by operation_Name

requests
| where $__timeFilter(timestamp)
| where client_Type != "Browser"
| where ("All" in ($operation_name) or operation_Name in ($operation_name))
| top 1 by duration asc
| project tostring(duration)

requests
| where $__timeFilter(timestamp)
| where client_Type != "Browser"
| where ("All" in ($operation_name) or operation_Name in ($operation_name))
| top 1 by duration
| project tostring(duration)

title: ${title}
